message:
Hola Sophomore!!!

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur welcomes you all back to the campus.
In your one year stay at IIT Kharagpur, you must have noticed that there are opportunities for both sending our students to international universities as well as bringing in International students to IIT Kharagpur. This is what International Relations Cell works for and it contributes significantly in determining the QS ranking of the institute. The recent improvement in our QS rankings glorifies the work we have done in the past few years and we are extremely motivated to take our institute further on the international front. Let us come together and work for our institute. Let us take KGP to new heights.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is recruiting second years!!
Don't miss a chance to be a part of the IRC family!
Here is the link to the Google form to register for the group discussion:
https://goo.gl/forms/0MQTEe9paAtehrP43
Deadline to fill this form: 26th July

The Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, features among the top 100 in the Times Higher Education Golden Age University Rankings and top 50 in the Emerging University Rankings.
The Golden Age ranking casts spotlight on the best universities established for more than 50 years, but less than 80 years.The universities were measured across their "core missions" - teaching, research, citations, international outlook and industry income. University of California, San Diego, tops the list. IIT Kharagpur has been placed in the 76th position.
IIT KGP was also placed 45th in the list The Emerging Economies University Rankings 2018 which included 350 universities from 42 countries.

Read more at:
//economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/64965639.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst

You always have space for improvement, no matter how long you’ve been in the pursuit. With this in mind, IIT Kharagpur, the oldest of the sister IITs is continually climbing the ladder since the past 3 years. Striving towards excellence and a world class reputation in all fields, IIT Kharagpur has jumped 13 ranks up from 308 to 295, and is back into the league of the top 300 universities in the world in the QS World University Ranking.  Improvements have been recorded in the scores for International Faculty and International Students.
We are in the beginning of a great journey and with determination, focus and hard work we strive to keep moving ahead in all spheres, to place IIT Kharagpur among the top universities of the world.

We are delighted to announce a pilot program on Reciprocal Short-term Student Exchange between IIT Kharagpur and Texas A&M University. Three students from either campus are visiting the other for short term project works. This program demonstrates our commitment to build sustainable partnerships with world class institutions for mutual benefit. We hope to sign the agreement on reciprocal exchange with TAMU soon and make this exchange an annual event.  We extend a warm welcome to the students from Texas A&M University and hope they have an enriching experience at our institute. To know more about the programme and various facilities provided to the students, please go through the blog:

https://ircell.wordpress.com/2018/06/06/reciprocal-student-exchange-program-with-texas-am-university/

IIT Kharagpur signs agreements with University of Melbourne and University of Newcastle of Australia, for joint study programmes. From the semester beginning in July, full time Dual Doctoral Program (DDP) will be rolled out in collaboration with University of Melbourne. Meanwhile, the MoU with University of Newcastle is focused on joint academic and research programmes, joint supervision of doctoral and masters students and other exchange and knowledge sharing initiatives.

http://www.millenniumpost.in/kolkata/iit-kgp-joins-hands-with-2-australian-varsities-for-joint-study-programmes-302481

https://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kharagpur-s-agreements-with-australian-univs-for-jt-study-118060100761_1.html

It's the time of the Fourth Industrial Revolution!!  This opens up a galore of new opportunities. In order to convey the latest developments and develop the acumen of thinking the tech way, fundoo.info has been launched by an IIT Madras Alumnus. fundoo.info  brings in Industry Thought Leaders, Entrepreneurs and Academicians on a Webinar Channel -  Emerging Trends and Industry Insights. With the aim of hosting such leaders and provide a platform for young generation to learn, fundoo.info is organising webinars on various topics. Webinars on Blockchain, AI, Solar and Customer Success Management have already received  great response. More details on: https://fundoo.info 
fundoo.info invites IIT Kharagpur Alumni who are entrepreneurs and Thought Leaders as Guest Speakers and encourages the Kgp fraternity to follow the webinars in order to take edge of the latest developments in technology.

Grand Announcement for all the International students

IIT Kharagpur has revised its procedure for accepting foreign students for doctoral programs.
The change has been in the admission criteria of students not from a Dual Doctoral Program(DDP)  Partner Institution
Note : Admission criteria for Dual Doctoral Program(DDP) students from partner Institutions is governed by their MoUs.
For a non DPP Partner institution student the steps for admission are as follows:
Criteria set by Department /School/Centre that may include the applicant’s academic record, qualification and a sufficiently long interview administered in video conferencing mode.
TOEFL/GRE scores.
Two Letters of reference from professional contacts.
Applicant must also comply with the Govt. of India rules regarding his country of citizenship and current immigration status in India. If an applicant qualifies the given criteria and accepts the provisional offer letter, he/she is issued the visa letters as per Govt. rules.
After admission, all the PhD rules of the Institute will be applicable for the student, but there may be few exceptions for DDP student from a partner Institution.

Note : All the applicants have to fill up the preliminary application form and send it with all the attachments to  ir-office@adm.iitkgp.ac.in irrespective of the fact that they are from a DPP partner institute or not.
PLease have a look at both the links for details and for the application form
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BO0Qz8Zq1TJr0ZeghlLs5BigoN9puI5l/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/10t49tVGhuDlRngliWwMbEw91_NPEFbra/view?usp=sharing

Reachivy Scholarship:

ReachIvy is a premium education & careers advisory firm that helps students get accepted into top-tier education institutions globally. 

ReachIvy Scholarship provides free support to students looking to apply to top-ranked colleges anywhere in the world. The scholarship is awarded to meritorious students, irrespective of their background or financial status.

Every year ReachIvy selects 5-10 students for its annual Scholarship where up to 5 winners get mentored by  team of Experts and upto 5 winners get free assistance on their applications. Academic performance is not the sole criteria.
Eligiblity: Applicats who are planning to start Masters program ( MBA and MS) between 2019 to 2022
Application Deadline: 31 May 2018
For more Information: https://www.reachivy.com/reachivy-scholarship.html

Universite De Lille, France is offering PhD positions to interested and eligible students at the IEMN Laboratory of the University. 
The subject title for the PhD is ‘ Acoustical tweezers based on acoustical vortices for the selective 3D contactless manipulation of micro-metric particles in a micro-fluidic environment.’

Interested Students at IIT Kharagpur are requested to take this into consideration and contact the respective Professor for the same.

NOTE: Deadline for filling the application form is May 22,2018 12 midnight
To know more about this offer visit the following link:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6GKCx3COIjXTzVpY0JoaUFuQW1zNlVSVGFkWkZHZV95anZB

IIT Kharagpur highly appreciates the efforts of the embassy of Japan, New Delhi to help in the release of the following scholarships. The Public Notices in respect to the aforementioned scholarships/fellowships have already been displayed on the website of the Ministry of Human Resource development i.e.  www.mhrd.gov.in/scholarships. 

1) Japanese Government [MEXT] Scholarship Program 2019 for Research Students
 Last Date of application: 01.06.2018
1. For Master’s degree:
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field with minimum 65% marks. The candidates should obtain their mark sheet and degree on or before 31st March 2019, for April 2019 batch and 30th September 2019 for October 2019 batch
2. For Ph.D. degree : 
Master’s degree in relevant field with minimum 65% marks. The candidates must have practical research/teaching/work experience after obtaining the prescribed qualification on or before 31st March 2019.

Age: born after April 2, 1984
Website: http://www.in.emb-japan.go.jp/Education/Research_Student.html

2) Japanese Government [MEXT] Scholarship Program 2019 for undergraduate students, college of technology students and specialized training college students
 Last Date of application: 15.06.2018
The scholarship offers the student to study as an Undergraduate student, College of Technology student and Specialized Training College student.
Website: http://www.in.emb-japan.go.jp/Education/japanese_government_scholarships.html

3) USIEF Fellowships for Indian Citizens: 2019-2020
Last Date of application: 15.06.2018

2019-2020 Fulbright-Nehru, Fulbright-Kalam, and other Fulbright fellowships have been made available for Indian Citizens.
Website: http://www.usief.org.in/Fellowships/Fellowships-for-Indian-Citizens.aspx

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message: We are elated to announce the University of Newcastle Australia as a partnered university of IIT Kharagpur. An MoU facilitating the same has been signed between the two Institutions during the recently concluded trip to Australia by the Dean of International Relations, Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya. The partnership aims to promote collaboration in academic and research activities. The two Institutions are now actively exploring student exchange and dual degree programs.  Please contact the Office of International Relations for more details.

The Human Resource Developement ministry has come up with the just right solution to make India a potential education destination for foreign students. To know more details about this programme visit the following link:
https://www.financialexpress.com/education-2/studying-in-india-made-easier-heres-how-centres-initiative-can-help-foreign-students/1138010/

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Siddharth Saharan.
message:
We take pride in announcing the Core Team of International Relations Cell for the Academic Year 2018-2019. Hearty Congratulations to each and every one of them. 
The team includes:
General Secretaries:
Ritik Chachan
Manthan Doshi

Coordinators:
Ayush Sinha
Pankaj Sinha
Prachi Agrawal
Sudhir Singh Bhadouria
Rohan Dodrajka
Manmohan Sandhu
Aayush Sacheti
Pushpendra Singh Champawat

Design Coordinator:
Raj Kishor

Web Coordinator:
Tarun Kumar

The cell has grown tremendously over the past year and we are extremely grateful to our senior team for this. Your leadership styles and relentless efforts shall always keep the new team motivated to achieve new heights. Thank you Raj Kolamuri, Shubham Srivastava, Shubham Arora, Siddharth Saharan, Navya Mokmod, Tyss Santosh, Vivek Yadav, Aditya Bhandari.
We wish you success in all your future endeavors. .

Professor S. Jon Chapman and Professor Colin P. Please from the Mathematical Institute, University of Oxford are looking to fill two postdoc positions in the area of battery modeling. They are expecting to hire people from mathematics or people who have had a good experience in mathematical modeling. It is not necessary that the candidate has had prior experience in modeling batteries.

Details and further particulars can be found at:
https://www.maths.ox.ac.uk/node/28140

Applications for this vacancy are to be made online.  To apply for this post and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below
https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.display_form

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is proud to announce that the website for International Relations of IIT KGP is now up and running with the joint efforts of the Cell and the Office of International Relations. 

To access, please visit www.international.iitkgp.ac.in

It contains various resources for IITKgp students and faculty, and for our international partners, such as information regarding different programs and funding. You can also access the FTP portal from the website.
We will keep updating the pages with new initiatives and information. We invite you to go through the contents and give your constructive suggestions.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is elated to announce the results of IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) USA Award Program for International Student Internships. We appreciate Mr. Ranbir Gupta for the initiative and thank him for his extended support.

IITKGPF will now support these meritorious students for their International Internships. The value of the award will be administered directly by the IITKGPF.

International Relations Cell congratulates you all.

International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is elated to announce the outcome of our initiative, the results of IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) USA Award Program for International Student Internships.

IITKGPF will now support these meritorious students for their International Summer Internships.The students shall be awarded an amount of 3000-5000 USD depending upon the quality of proposed research and academic standing and will be administered directly by IITKGPF.

IIT Kharagpur and International Relations Cell congratulates these students.

Selected students are requested contact OIR, IIT Kharagpur for information regarding dissemination of funding.

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Gaurav Gardi and 5 others.
message:
International Relations Cell is delighted at the success of MS/PhD seminar organized on Sunday, 18th March. Students who aspire to pursue higher education in future turned out in huge numbers and the panelists made sure that they explain the whole application procedure and enlighten them about the various aspects concerned with application for MS and PhD. All in all, we really hope that the students who attended the seminar were motivated and inspired.
Here are  a few glimpses of the seminar.

Many students often miss out the opportunity to participate in foreign competitions due to lack of funding or other financial issues. To increase opportunities and exposure to international competitions, IR Cell presents you with the  IIT Kharagpur Foundation of USA Award Program for International Student Competitions.
This Program will support the most deserving student teams with partial support to attend high-quality international competitions.
Applications may be made through the Office of International Relations using the attached application form.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4SFNZdDMyRTNWUkxIcHlOc1NfWGZvLU0yQks0

Details of the program:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Rm6F0ijiKzyA75PSrRUhBfxwcGVOLZHl/view?usp=sharing

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added an event.
message:
If you are confused about whether you want to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs, come join us the Ms/PhD panel discussion organized by International Relational Cell, IIT Kharagpur. A panel consisting of elite students who have chosen to pursue higher education will help you clear all your doubts and queries.
Date: 06:30PM
Time: 18-03-2018
Veunu: V3

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Asish Koruprolu and 3 others.
message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
                                                                                                                               -Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!

Hola First Years!
Do you wish to have an insight on how International Relations Cell contributes in improving the global ranking of IIT Kharagpur? 
Here lies the opportunity. 
Register at http://bit.ly/IRCELL2018
International Relations Cell IIT Kharagpur opens its doors for the first years to be a “Theme for our Team”. Through this selection, we provide first years the opportunities to solve a number of intensive case studies and analyze various programs that could benefit IIT Kgp at the global level.
Like Audrey Hepburn always says “Opportunities don’t often come along. So when they do, you have to grab them.”
So grab a motive and be there!
Well, we are not done yet. We are also selecting the design team and web team members. So all the interested newbies do come!

S-Set sail on an international adventure                                 
E-Escalate your technical and cultural skills
P-Perceive the best opportunity of a lifetime

IR cell is proud to announce the first of its kind initiative in the history of IIT Kgp, the commencement of the Reciprocal Student Exchange Program. Years of continued efforts are now resulting in unique collaborations between IIT Kgp and global institutions on mutual exchange of value basis. We are elated to announce the first such collaboration with the Leibniz University of Hanover, Germany. Applications are now open for 4 opportunities under the program with tuition fee waiver and free accommodation at the host university. We believe this is a great start and encourage every student to explore SEP. Please follow the prescribed application procedure under SAP on our website: international.iitkgp.ac.in

We believe in growing by increasing exposure to the students and hope this will open a plethora of options in the future. We assure you many great collaborations in the near future!!

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.

The last step of this Future Tour will be organized on 17th and 18th February in Ahmedabad on the topic: "Smart cities: urban planning, architecture, and design".
 
Draft program :
Day 1 17th Feb at CEPT :
9 am: Opening session
Two parallel sessions of 4 Round Tables each, one session on Saturday morning (9:30 to 12 am) and the second one on Saturday afternoon (2 to 5 pm). And a networking dinner on Saturday evening at NOVOTEL Ahmedabad.
 
Day 2 18th Feb at NIRMA University
On Sunday morning there will be some presentations of existing Indo French partnerships as well as a session dedicated to PPP.
Sunday afternoon: one to one meetings between students, alumni, universités, and companies. 
Kindly refer to the following links for details about the programme:
https://www.campusfrance.org/en/agenda/future-tours-india-2018

Around 6-8 people will be invited to each roundtable.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4NS1KMnlMWUp6OXUyMVowTUQxeW1hV2daU3FJ

Caltech's Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowships (SURF) program introduces students to research under the guidance of seasoned research mentors at Caltech and JPL.

SURF is modeled on the grant-seeking process:

Students collaborate with a potential mentor to define and develop a project
Applicants write research proposals as part of the application process
Faculty review the proposals and recommend awards
Students carry out the work over a 10-week period during the summer
At the conclusion of the program, students submit a technical paper and give an oral presentation at one of several SURF Seminar Days, symposia modeled on a professional technical meeting.
Fellows receive a $6,275 award for the ten-week period. Award payments are distributed in equal installments in late June and late July. 
For all further details kindly refer to the following link:
https://www.sfp.caltech.edu/programs/surf

The Department of Science & Technology (DST), Govt. of India and Indo-U.S. Science & Technology Forum (IUSSTF) has jointly announced a new fellowship program for Women "Indo-U.S. Fellowship for Women in STEMM (WISTEMM)" (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics and Medicine).The program aims to provide opportunities to Indian Women Scientists, Engineers & Technologists to undertake international collaborative research in premier institutions in the U.S.A, to enhance their research capacities and capabilities.The deadline for submission of applications is 28 th February 2018. This is a great opportunity for Indian women students to gain ground in their respective research areas. IR cell encourages all eligible Kgp’ians to make use of the opportunity. For more info, refer to the following link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16_bp-e8GQDAvODL7bvffbraVmeqAuXdC/view?usp=sharing

Nanyang Technological University, Singapore hosts The NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme which is a university-wide short-term research programme that lasts for 2 to 6 months.Students of this programme will work under the supervision of NTU faculty, develop a strong research interest and expertise in a given research field, experience multicultural living, gain a network of friends and a better understanding of Singapore.
 
Eligible students may be given an allowance and are expected to fulfil a minimum of 2 months research attachment involving research project work at NTU. Student will also receive a certificate issued by NTU-India Connect office upon completion of the programme.

Please read the following important note before applying:​ 

Internship Period

NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 will fall within the following periods:-

Batch 1 (3rd January 2018 to 1st June 2018)
Batch 2 (8th May 2018 to 13th July 2018)
Batch 3 (1st August 2018 to 31st December 2018)
​​For Batch 1 and 3, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 5 months.
For Batch 2, students are encouraged to stay for a minimum of 2 months.

Application Period
The opening and closing dates for NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme 2018 is stated below.

Batch 1 (15th July 2017 to 31 August 2017)
Batch 2 (1st November 2017 to 31st December 2017)
Batch 3 (1st February 2018 to 31st March 2018)​

Eligibility Criteria
Open to Pre-final year graduates / undergraduates who have not studied in NTU previously.

​​Qualification ​Duration ​Eligible period ​
 B Tech / B.Sc. (Degree) 
​4 years Pre-final year - End of 3rd year​
​M Tech / M.Sc. (Master) ​2 years Pre-final year - End of 1st year​​
​M + B / M.Sc. + B.Sc. 
(Dual Degree)​ ​5 years ​Pre-final year - End of 4th year​​
Students must possess good academic track records. 
M​ust be a student pursuing his / her studies in an Indian University / Institute of higher learning upon the period of his / her internship with NTU. 
Students that meet the minimum requirement with scholarships, publication and internship experiences will be given preference.​​
For all further details about the application procedure and other details,kindly visit: http://global.ntu.edu.sg/GMP/ic/Pages/default.aspx

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is with Baidurya Bhattacharya.
message: An important announcement by the board members has marked a new milestone for the IRCell by appointment of a new Dean to oversee all our activities. Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya will lead us as the Dean of International Relations henceforth. We have come a long way since the inception of the cell and now we wish to thrive under the new leadership of Dean Baidurya Bhattacharya. It'll be our immense pleasure to work under his guidance and build the international relations of IIT KGP. We are assured that he'll help us touch new heights with his vision. A hearty welcome to him and a new beginning!

IR Cell, IIT Kharagpur is exhilarated with student’s response for application of foreign internship at the Foreign Training Portal.

The students are kindly requested to take a note of the following points:-

1. The deadline of application for the first series of project has been extended to 31st of January, 6:00 P.M. (IST). No further extension will be done under any circumstances.

2. The students can apply with a CV specific to the project. The students have to register with one single CV, however, the student may upload a new CV specific to the project in the “apply now” tab. This new CV (if uploaded) will be shared with the concerned professor for application.

3. Both UG and PG students can apply for the projects on the portal. If a student is facing difficulties with any part of the application process, he/she may reach out to us at:-

 irc@iitkgp.ac.in 

4. The students are requested to keep checking our Facebook page and the portal for new projects to apply.

The link to the portal is:-

 http://www.ircell.iitkgp.ac.in/ftp/portal/login/

For any queries, please contact

Shubham Arora

The IU School of Informatics, Computing, and Engineering at Indiana University, Bloomington provides a ten-week summer research program named IU-SROC (Summer Research Opportunities in Computing) . This is to attract high potential undergraduate students to do research in the fields of computer science, bioinformatics, human centered computing, computer vision, health informatics, security, cloud computing, Interactive Intelligent Systems, text mining and high performance computing.

Eligibility: Full-time undergraduate student in an accredited university anywhere in the world.
Period: 8-10 weeks during the summer months of May through July.

Application Deadline: February 16, 2018

Application Material:

1. CV, highlighting top academic and research performances 
2. An unofficial transcript from the college you are currently attending (an official transcript will be required once a participation offer has been accepted) 
3. At least one letter of recommendation from a faculty member

Fellowship : $5000 + housing and a meal plan for this ten-week program

Description :This full time research experience includes work in the lab with a faculty and PhD student mentor, weekly professional development colloquia series and a technical writing workshop. At the conclusion of the program, all students participate in the IU Summer STEM Scholars research poster session and closing ceremony. Participants will have to prepare both oral and written summaries of their research projects.

For completing the entire application process please visit: 

https://iu.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_01zb9jiggRqnIvH

French Embassy in India and Institut Francais en Inde (IFI) is organizing the Future tour for the first time that brings together scientists, academics and companies to discuss future partnerships between India and France under the third edition of Bonjour India in five different cities from 29th January - 18th February 2018.
The objective of these Future Tours are:
- to bring about joint initiatives in training, research and innovation.
- to promote the French training offer and to meet the students.
The agenda of the meeting is also to explore possibilities of collaboration and to deliver recommendations for the first high level Indo-French Knowledge Summit which will transpire in New Delhi in mid-March 2018 in the presence of President of France and Prime Minister of India. 

This Summit will bring together academia and industry from both countries to create a road map for education, research cooperation and mobility for the next 5 years.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0-WusIde2k4NS1KMnlMWUp6OXUyMVowTUQxeW1hV2daU3FJ

With immense progress in science and technology, the young generation has failed to witness the rich culture and heritage of India. There are many organisations and individuals who are working hard to make an attempt in preserving this rich culture of our motherland. Keeping the same in mind, an international convention will be organised by SPIC MACAY, IIT Kharagpur and The Bengal Chamber at the IIT Kharagpur campus from June 3 to June 9. Aimed mainly at promotion of Indian Classical music and culture among youth this programme will have participants from different countries apart from various parts of India.
Kindly refer to the given link for further information

http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/spic-macay-iit-kharagpur-and-bengal-chamber-to-organise-international-convention/1013933/

This post is meant for all the students who are aspiring for graduate studies especially from Computer Science stream.
The million dollar question: What next?
Each one of us wonders about the prospects of future after completion of our course. While USA and Canada seems like the lucrative choices for graduate studies, it is still hard to decide if you want to invest that amount of money and effort. Now get your queries answered in an extremely interactive session by Prof. Sourabh Bagchi from Purdue University.
Get insights on the subject and decide the best for your future! 
Date: Jan 9, 2018
Venue: V 1
Time: 6 PM

It is our honor to introduce Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya who will lead the Office of Alumni Affairs and International Relations in the capacity of Dean henceforth. We aspire to take IIT Kharagpur to great heights under your leadership. We are thankful for the continued support of Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay who was instrumental in the formation and growth of IR Cell. Your dedication, energy and smile will always be an inspiration. Our best wishes for the coming year to all!!

Do you have an idea that can revolutionize mobility? Do you have an idea that can compete with the Hyperloop? If yes, here is your chance to showcase your talents. The French Embassy in India is organizing Easy Ride, a 2-day hackathon on the theme of smart and sustainable mobility. Easy Ride is a prototype and design competition that brings together teams of creative and ingenious students to come with innovative solutions on the theme of Smart and Sustainable Mobility. 
All the interested students are supposed to contact Mrs. Alivia Nag(alivia.nag@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in), International Relations Executive of IIT Kharagpur at the Office of International Relations. 
Please refer to the following link for more details: https://www.veltechuniv.edu.in/easy-ride/

Self Recommendation Letter | NTU-India Connect Programme

Since, we have been getting several requests regarding the self recommendation letter for NTU-India Connect Programme, in view of public interest, we suggest a few guidelines for the same. Self recommendation letter should have the following details:
1.Name
2.Year and department
3.Your competencies, achievements and awards
4.Your CGPA    
5.Your interests and why do you want to join NTU India Connect
   Programme

Please refer to the following link for a sample self recommendation letter: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORdvW9-rzIUJehNpT5EEGICVpyhVgnDTlIiNy1FAkAQ/edit?usp=sharing

IR Cell presents you with Global Leadership Series, a unique series of interviews, discussions and guest lectures about leadership at the global stage. Today, we have with us Ranbir (Ron) Singh Gupta, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur from the batch of 1970, B.Arch. Ron Gupta is a top-notch architect in the US with his own company based in New York. Along with his wife, Chitra, Ron created the “Ranbir and Chitra Gupta School of Infrastructure Design and Management“ (RCGSIDM), first such school of its kind in the world. Here is a short discussion on his philosophy of giving back, objectives of the RCGSIDM School and some advice for the young entrepreneurs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrIYXsEM11Q

S.T.E.A.M School - an interdisciplinary hands-on  education and problem-solving programme, based on United Nation's Sustainable  Development Goals is conducting a 10-day programme, an immersive  experience with a mix of project-based learning, field trials, mentoring  sessions and digital prototyping. Participants include students,  academicians, scientists, engineers, architects, doctors, environmentalists,  strategists and artists besides others in the creative economy.  This presents a unique opportunity for innovative and dynamic students to  interact with a different cohort of people involved in social purpose. IR Cell encourages every IIT Kharagpur student to participate in it. Follow this link to apply:  https://steam.makersasylum.com/school/
